question.text: Given below are four methods and their mode of action in achieving contraception. Find the incorrect match.

options.text: Cervical caps - Prevent sperms reaching cervix
Periodic abstinence - Natural method that avoids chances of ovum and sperms meeting.
Cu 375 - Suppress sperm motility and fertilising capacity of sperms.

solution.text: Saheli is the World's first and the only non-hormonal, nonsteroidal, safe, once-a-week oral contraceptive. Saheli is the only anti-implantation agent approved for clinical use in the world. Saheli (centchroman/ormeloxifene) gets absorbed in the body and causes an asynchrony in the menstrual cycle between ovulation and the uterine lining development. The contraceptive does not affect ovulation directly and thus do not induce any hormonal imbalance, but prevents implantation.
